title: Englishpod 初级 英文播客 0004

segments.en: Hello, everyone, and welcome to EnglishPod.
My name is Marco.
I'm Amira.
Hey, Amira.
How are you today?
I'm doing great.
What about you?
I'm doing pretty good.
I'm excited about this lesson that you have for us today.
segments.cn: 我对你今天为我们准备的这节课很期待。

segments.en: Yes, it's actually a very, very useful lesson.
segments.cn: 是的，这实际上是一节非常有用的课。

segments.en: It's about someone asking his boss for an assistant.
segments.cn: 这是关于某人向他的老板请求一个助手。

segments.en: Oh, okay, an assistant.
What's an assistant?
Well, it's someone who helps you with your work around the office.
segments.cn: 嗯，就是帮助你处理办公室工作的人。

segments.en: Okay, great.
So let's listen to this dialogue.
segments.cn: 那我们来听这个对话吧。

segments.en: And when we come back, we'll take a look at all the interesting and useful vocabulary that you'll find.
segments.cn: 回来后，我们将看看所有有趣和有用的词汇。

segments.en: Like I told you before, we just don't have the resources to hire you an assistant.
segments.cn: 就像我之前告诉你的，我们没有资源来雇你一个助手。

segments.en: I understand that.
But the fact is, we're understaffed.
segments.cn: 但事实是，我们人手不足。

segments.en: The timing is just not right.
The economy's bad, and it's too risky to take on new staff.
segments.cn: 经济不好，雇新员工风险太大。

segments.en: Yeah, I guess you're right.
Here's an idea.
What if we hire an intern?
segments.cn: 如果我们雇一个实习生呢？

segments.en: She would take some of the weight off my shoulders.
segments.cn: 她可以减轻我的一些负担。

segments.en: She?
Yeah, you know, a recent graduate, she could give me a hand with some of these projects, and we could keep our costs down.
segments.cn: 是的，你知道的，最近毕业的，她可以帮我处理一些项目，我们可以控制成本。

segments.en: That sounds reasonable.
Let me see what I can do.
Tony, I'd like to introduce you to your new assistant.
segments.cn: Tony，我想介绍你认识你新的助手。

segments.en: Okay, great.
Let's meet her.
Hi, I'm Adam.
Oh, hi, I'm Tony.
And we're back, Tony.
He's surprised, huh?
Yeah, he's I don't know why, though, he's surprised.
segments.cn: 是的，我不知道为什么，他很惊讶。

segments.en: I think we should talk about that a little bit later.
segments.cn: 我想我们应该稍后再谈这个。

segments.en: Yes, for now, let's look at some interesting vocabulary and phrases here.
segments.cn: 是的，暂时让我们看看这里一些有趣的词汇和短语。

segments.en: Marco, I know you've chosen one for us.
segments.cn: Marco，我知道你为我们选择了一个。

segments.en: Yeah, the first one that I want to take a look at is resources.
segments.cn: 是的，我想先看看的是资源。

segments.en: resources, resources, resources.
And that means in this text, basically money, right?
segments.cn: 在这段文本中，这基本上是指钱，对吧？

segments.en: So the office doesn't have enough money.
segments.cn: 所以办公室没有足够的钱。

segments.en: Okay, I've chosen another interesting word for you.
segments.cn: 好的，我为你选择了另一个有趣的词。

segments.en: And that's understaffed, understaffed, understaffed, understaffed.
segments.cn: 那就是人手不足，人手不足，人手不足，人手不足。

segments.en: Now, understaffed means that they don't have enough people working there.
segments.cn: 现在，人手不足意味着他们没有足够的人在那工作。

segments.en: They don't have enough workers, right?
segments.cn: 他们没有足够的工人，对吧？

segments.en: They don't have enough employees.
Perfect.
Okay.
The next one is timing is just not right.
The timing is just not right.
The timing is just not right.
The timing is just not right.
Okay, let's listen to how we can use this entire phrase in a different situation.
segments.cn: 好的，让我们听听如何在不同情况下使用这个完整的短语。

segments.en: So then we can understand what it means.
segments.cn: 这样我们就能理解它的意思。

segments.en: Let's listen.
I was going to sell my house, but the timing is just not right.
segments.cn: 我本打算卖掉我的房子，但时机不对。

segments.en: Honey, I think we should have a baby.
segments.cn: 亲爱的，我觉得我们应该要个孩子。

segments.en: The timing is just not right.
Okay, great.
I guess that makes it clear.
Yes, actually, it's very obvious that it means that it's just not a good time.
segments.cn: 是的，实际上，很明显这意味着现在不是个好时机。

segments.en: Right.
Perfect.
I have another interesting phrase for you, which is weight off my shoulders.
segments.cn: 我还有另一个有趣的短语给你，那就是减轻我的负担。

segments.en: Weight off my shoulders.
Weight off my shoulders.
Weight off my shoulders.
So to take weight off my shoulders is another way of saying to help me with my work or to take some of my work away from me.
segments.cn: 所以减轻我的负担是另一种说法，表示帮助我工作或减轻我的一些工作。

segments.en: If you have a lot of things to do and I come and help you, that means that I took some of the weight off your shoulders.
segments.cn: 如果你有很多事情要做，而我来帮你，那就意味着我减轻了你的负担。

segments.en: Let's look at the next phrase that we have here, and it's give me a hand.
segments.cn: 让我们看看下一个短语，就是帮我一个忙。

segments.en: Give me a hand.
Give me a hand.
Give me a hand.
Okay, now this is not literal.
It's not that I'm going to give you somebody's hand, right?
segments.cn: 不是说我要给你某人的手，对吧？

segments.en: Let's listen to some examples and then we can come back and explain what it means.
segments.cn: 让我们听一些例子，然后我们可以回来解释它的意思。

segments.en: Can you give me a hand with these boxes?
segments.cn: 你能帮我搬这些箱子吗？

segments.en: Neil, I'll need you to give me a hand with the sales reports.
segments.cn: Neil，我需要你帮我处理销售报告。

segments.en: Here, let me give you a hand with your suitcase.
All right, give me a hand is another way of saying help or to help out.
segments.cn: 好吧，帮我一个忙是另一种说法，表示帮助或帮忙。

segments.en: Exactly, to help out.
Right.
Perfect.
Now, the last phrase we're going to look at here in this dialogue is keep our costs down.
segments.cn: 现在，我们要在这个对话中看的最后一个短语是控制我们的成本。

segments.en: Keep our costs down.
Keep our costs down.
Keep our costs down.
So to keep our costs down means to try and not spend so much money.
segments.cn: 所以控制我们的成本意味着尽量不花太多钱。

segments.en: Exactly.
Many companies, for example, now control how much printing you do.
segments.cn: 例如，许多公司现在控制你打印的数量。

segments.en: Yes, right.
To keep the costs down of paper.
Yes.
So in other words, they do not want to have unnecessary spending.
segments.cn: 换句话说，他们不想有不必要的开支。

segments.en: Perfect.
OK, I think it's time for us to listen to this dialogue one more time.
segments.cn: 好吧，我想是时候再听一次这个对话了。

segments.en: But I want everyone to listen and see why Tony is surprised at the end when he meets his intern, when he meets his assistant.
segments.cn: 但我希望大家听听，为什么托尼在最后见到他的实习生和助理时会感到惊讶。

segments.en: Like I told you before, we just don't have the resources to hire you an assistant.
segments.cn: 就像我之前告诉你的，我们真的没有资源雇佣你一个助理。

segments.en: I understand that, but the fact is we're understaffed.
segments.cn: 我明白，但事实是我们人手不足。

segments.en: The timing is just not right.
The economy's bad and it's too risky to take on new staff.
segments.cn: 经济不好，雇佣新员工风险太大。

segments.en: Yeah, I guess you're right.
Here's an idea.
What if we hire an intern?
segments.cn: 如果我们雇一个实习生呢？

segments.en: She would take some of the weight off my shoulders.
segments.cn: 她可以减轻我的一些负担。

segments.en: She?
Yeah, you know, a recent graduate, she could give me a hand with some of these projects and we could keep our costs down.
segments.cn: 是的，你知道的，最近毕业的，她可以帮我处理一些项目，我们可以降低成本。

segments.en: That sounds reasonable.
Let me see what I can do.
Tony, I'd like to introduce you to your new assistant.
segments.cn: 托尼，我想介绍你认识你的新助理。

segments.en: Okay, great.
Let's meet her.
Hi, I'm Adam.
Oh, hi.
I'm Tony.
Well, you know, Marco, I think that Tony was really surprised because he was kind of hoping to have a female intern.
segments.cn: 嗯，你知道，马尔科，我觉得托尼真的很惊讶，因为他有点希望能有一个女实习生。

segments.en: Yeah, I think that's exactly what he was expecting.
segments.cn: 是的，我觉得这正是他所期待的。

segments.en: Maybe this guy is a little bit sexist.
segments.cn: 也许这个家伙有点性别歧视。

segments.en: He thought that an intern should be a girl, but instead...
segments.cn: 他认为实习生应该是女孩，但结果...

segments.en: Instead he got Adam.
Exactly.
And it looks like Adam is really big and really tall because he's got that deep voice.
segments.cn: 看起来亚当真的很大很高，因为他的声音很低沉。

segments.en: Right.
An intern, Marco, do you want to elaborate on that?
segments.cn: 实习生，马尔科，你想详细说明一下吗？

segments.en: Working at a company with a very low salary or sometimes no salary at all.
segments.cn: 在一家薪水非常低或有时根本没有薪水的公司工作。

segments.en: But what you're gaining is experience and you're learning a lot of things.
segments.cn: 但你获得的是经验，学到了很多东西。

segments.en: Everyone who has been an intern or had an intern knows that sometimes they are not treated all that well.
segments.cn: 每个曾经做过实习生或有实习生的人都知道，有时他们并没有得到很好的对待。

segments.en: Sometimes they just serve coffee or they have to do paperwork.
segments.cn: 有时他们只是端咖啡，或者必须做文书工作。

segments.en: Or like photocopying things.
Exactly.
But some internships are really, really cool and some are really good experiences for learning.
segments.cn: 但有些实习确实非常酷，有些是很好的学习经验。

segments.en: Yes, definitely.
Actually, I know a friend of mine, she used to work as an intern in one of those really big companies.
segments.cn: 实际上，我有一个朋友，她曾在一家非常大的公司做实习生。

segments.en: And she told me that she has gained so much experience doing that.
segments.cn: 她告诉我，她在那样做中获得了很多经验。

segments.en: Yeah, I mean, even if you don't get paid, the experience that you get is really good.
segments.cn: 是的，我的意思是，即使你没有得到报酬，你获得的经验也非常好。

segments.en: And that just opens doors for maybe getting another job.
segments.cn: 这为你获得另一份工作打开了大门。

segments.en: Or sometimes the interns get hired by the company to stay because they do such a good job.
segments.cn: 有时实习生会被公司雇佣留下，因为他们做得很好。

segments.en: Yeah, I think that's mostly the case, huh?
segments.cn: 是的，我想这大多数情况下都是这样，对吧？

segments.en: Yeah, that happened to me once I started working as an intern and after three months I was hired by the company.
segments.cn: 是的，我开始做实习生后，三个月后就被公司雇佣了。

segments.en: So it does happen.
So you did a good job.
Yeah, of course.
Alright, folks, we're out of time today.
segments.cn: 好吧，大家，今天时间到了。

segments.en: I hope that you enjoyed our lesson and we'll be back tomorrow with another really cool and really interesting lesson from EnglishPod.
segments.cn: 希望你们喜欢我们的课程，明天我们将带来另一节非常酷和有趣的课程来自EnglishPod。

segments.en: Don't forget to come to our website at EnglishPod.com where you'll find some really great and interesting resources to help you learn and improve your English even more.
segments.cn: 不要忘记访问我们的网站EnglishPod.com，在那里你会找到一些非常棒和有趣的资源，帮助你学习和提高你的英语。

segments.en: Yes, you should definitely do that.
segments.cn: 是的，你绝对应该这样做。

segments.en: And Marco and I would love to receive your comments and suggestions that you can leave on our community forum.
segments.cn: 马尔科和我很乐意收到你们的评论和建议，你可以在我们的社区论坛上留言。

segments.en: But for now, it's time for us to say bye.
segments.cn: 但现在，是时候说再见了。

segments.en: Bye.
